dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.tts_text: O H M Y G O S H!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I K N O W, R I G H T?!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Like, this Pfizer news from Israel? It's just... incredible!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Like, this Pfizer news from Israel? It's just... incredible!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Over 96% for illness and death, they're saying! Unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Over ninety six percent for illness and death, they're saying! Unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizers coronavirus vaccine staved off illness and death for over 95% of Israeli patients, according to government figures released Saturday from a report reviewed by multiple news outlets, encouraging news from the worlds most heavily vaccinated country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's gotta be such a relief for them after, like, all those lockdowns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's gotta be such a relief for them after, like, all those lockdowns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, completely! And they studied, what, 1.7 million people? That's not, like, a small sample.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, completely! And they studied, what, one point seven million people? That's not, like, a small sample.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israels Ministry of Health studied the roughly 1.7 million Israelis who had received both shots of Pfizers vaccine as of the end of last month, and released a report later obtained by Reuters and several local news outlets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, exactly! And the numbers are just jaw-dropping. 95.8% less likely to get sick!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, exactly! And the numbers are just jaw-dropping. ninety five point eight percent less likely to get sick!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And 98.9% less likely to be hospitalized or, uh, die! Oh, my god!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And ninety eight point nine percent less likely to be hospitalized or, uh, die! Oh, my god!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Especially for, like, the over 70s? Infection rate down 97%!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Especially for, like, the over 70s? Infection rate down ninety seven percent!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And even just one dose, they're saying 75% protection? It's just wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And even just one dose, they're saying seventy five percent protection? It's just wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: a non-peer reviewed study Thursday found just one dose of the vaccine reduces the risk of infection by 75% after two weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And they're just flying with the vaccinations, right? Over 32% fully vaccinated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're just flying with the vaccinations, right? Over thirty two percent fully vaccinated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 32.4%. Thats the share of Israelis who are fully vaccinated as of Saturday, according to the New York Times tracker.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Compared to our, like, 5.1% here? It's insane!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Compared to our, like, five point one percent here? It's insane!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The country ranks first in the world for vaccinations, compared to the United States 5.1% immunization rate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! They're just so efficient, small country, those HMOs...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! They're just so efficient, small country, those HMOs...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel is leading the worldwide vaccination race, partly due to the countrys small size, speed in buying up doses and comprehensive network of HMOs (the effort controversially doesnt include most residents of the West Bank and Gaza Strip).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Fauci even said it, "remarkable diminution." Like, that's a direct quote!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fauci even said it, remarkable diminution. Like, that's a direct quote!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel has a remarkable diminution in cases associated with the efficiency of their vaccine, U.S. infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci said Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I saw that! Yes, exactly! Though, uh, they're still watching out for the new variants, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I saw that! Yes, exactly! Though, uh, they're still watching out for the new variants, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Researchers are still studying whether new coronavirus mutations could blunt vaccines effectiveness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but still! They're talking about going back to normal, gyms, restaurants for vaccinated folks!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but still! They're talking about going back to normal, gyms, restaurants for vaccinated folks!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the coming weeks, residents who have received both Pfizer shots will get access to gyms, restaurants and bars, while those who cant prove vaccination or prior Covid-19 infection will need to stay away from nonessential places.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A real green pass! Like, wow!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A real green pass! Like, wow!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh, I just, I want that for us, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh, I just, I want that for us, you know?
